resources.string:
Let's say your username is johndoe. You can now use *@johndoe.anonaddy.com (or .me) as your email. Where * denotes any valid local part for an email address.

If you would like to remain anonymous choose a username that is not linked to your real name or identify and that you haven't used anywhere else.

You can also create aliases at shared domains if you are concerned about others linking alias ownership to you.

Either on the fly or generated beforehand. Next time you are signing up to a website or newsletter, simply make up a new alias and enter that instead of your real email address.

For example, if you are on vuejs.org and you want to sign up to their newsletter you could simply enter vuejs@johndoe.anonaddy.com (or .me). 

We'll automatically create the alias in your dashboard as soon as it receives its first email. You can reply to emails and send from aliases anonymously too!

Let's say a spammer gets hold of one of your aliases and starts sending unsolicited email to it. You can simply toggle a switch in your dashboard and deactivate that alias.

Our system will then silently discard any further emails and you won't be forwarded anything else for that alias.

You can also delete the alias. Then our system will reject any emails and respond with an error.
Sounds like a service you’d use? If so, why not sign up.
Your API can be obtained at the bottom of the settings page at app.anonaddy.com (or your own hosted instance)
Other aliases e.g. alias@%s.anonaddy.com or .me can also be created automatically when they receive their first email
Something went wrong while adding the alias
This is a not a valid domain
Change app theme to dark mode

What\'s new in version 3.1.3

Fixed/Improved

- Fixed some string issues
- Changed the return key into a search key on the keyboard when using the global search option
- Performance improvements and other things I might have forgot to make the app even smoother

The version of this AnonAddy instance is lower than the minimum required version to use this app. You can ignore this message and just use the app, but there is a good chance that some functions will not work.
Will Browning (AnonAddy)\nStjin (Android app backend)\nJPH (Android app designer)

Forgetting an alias will disassociate it from your account

Are you sure you want to forget this alias? Forgetting an alias will disassociate it from your account.\n\nNote: If this alias uses a shared domain then it can never be restored or used again so make sure you are certain. If it is a standard alias then it can be created again since it will be as if it never existed.
Rules work on all emails, including replies and also send froms. New conditions and actions will be added over time.

Alias already exists, opening alias settings…

Enter the email addresses (comma separated) of the recipients you’d like to send an email to from an alias.

Aliases you enter that do not exist will be created automatically.

The mail app on your device opens with the correct to addresses entered. Note that you must send this email from one of your verified recipients email address.

Leaving the alias field empty allows you to send emails from your own email address (not an alias).
Check out app-exclusive features and integrations

Create aliases on the go and send emails from an alias by highlighting an email address or tapping a mailto hyperlink.

Highlight an email address that doesn't exist with your domain name and tap the AnonAddy for Android icon to create this alias.

Highlight an email address and tap the AnonAddy for Android icon to send an email to this email address from an alias. You can also tap email addresses that contain a mailto hyperlink, such as those found on websites.
It may take a few minutes for the change to take effect

Keep track of emails being forwarded through a specific alias. Open the management page of an alias and enable \"Watch alias\" to be notified of a new forwarded message.\n\nUse the \"Background service interval\" option in the app settings to determine how often to check for new forwarded messages.

If you would like to search through failed deliveries, go back to main section and use the search button.
Something went wrong while deleting this failed delivery

For an overview of all failed deliveries, go back to main section and tap on the failed deliveries button at the top. (mail with exclamation mark)\n\nUse the \"Background service interval\" option in the app settings to determine how often to check for failed deliveries.
Open an overview of recent failed deliveries
Receive a notification if an email sent from an alias cannot be delivered
Please note that it may take a little longer for updates to be visible in F-Droid

Open the AnonAddy for Android app instead of the website for easy access and quick actions such as deactivating your alias via the link in the email banner.

Since this feature is not managed by AnonAddy for Android but by Android itself, manual action is required to link the URL to the app. On many devices this is done automatically, but on devices with Android 12 or higher it is necessary to add this URL manually. The action is easy but cannot be automated.

Due to limitations added in Android 12, it is only possible to use this integration on the hosted instance found at app.anonaddy.com.
Click on \"open by default\" and set app links to \"Open in this app\"
Click on \"open by default\" and set app links to \"Don\'t open in this app\"
Enable supported links, click on \"Add link\" and tick the checkbox in front of the URL
